item.title: Donald Trump: US Treasury should get cut of TikTok deal
item.description: The president has given Microsoft 45 days to reach a deal or he will ban the app in the US.

item.title: What's going on with TikTok?
item.description: Microsoft confirmed it wants to acquire TikTok after President Trump threatened to ban the app.

item.title: Coronavirus: Melbourne police 'assaulted and baited' over lockdown rules
item.description: A policewoman's head was repeatedly "smashed" in one incident in shopping centre, authorities say.

item.title: Audi drops 'insensitive' girl with banana ad
item.description: The German carmaker apologises for a tweeted car ad that sparked a furore.

item.title: Beach SOS saves men stranded on tiny Micronesian island
item.description: The Micronesian men were spotted by Australian and US aircraft after being reported missing on Saturday.

item.title: Hurricane Isaias lashes Carolinas amid warnings of life-threatening surges
item.description: Heavy rains and winds batter coastal areas, as officials warn of "life-threatening storm surges".

item.title: Coronavirus: Millions return to lockdown in Philippines
item.description: A strict curb on movements has been re-imposed in the capital Manila after a surge in Covid infections.

item.title: Spain's embattled ex-King Juan Carlos leaves country
item.description: His departure comes weeks after the former monarch was linked to a probe into alleged corruption.

item.title: NY attorney expands inquiry into Trump 'criminal conduct'
item.description: In a court filing, lawyers said the investigation spans over a decade of possible criminal activity.

item.title: 'How I found out Pablo Escobar was my father'
item.description: Phillip Witcomb speaks about his infamous father and how he grew up not knowing his true identity.

item.title: Kylie Moore-Gilbert: Australia says lecturer jailed in Iran 'is well'
item.description: Australia's ambassador visits Kylie Moore-Gilbert after she was moved to a notorious desert prison.

item.title: Article 370: Curfew in Kashmir as protesters plan 'black day'
item.description: Officials anticipate violence on the first anniversary of the revocation of the state's autonomy.

item.title: Boeing's 737 Max moves closer to flying again
item.description: US regulators have put forward a list of changes needed before the ill-fated planes can restart flights.

item.title: James Lovelock: Gaia theory creator on coronavirus and turning 101
item.description: British scientist James Lovelock says population growth means something like the virus is "almost inevitable".

item.title: TikTok: What TikTokers make of Trump's ban threat
item.description: The confusion around the video app's future has left creators at a loose end - or issuing goodbyes.

item.title: The trees that survived the bombing of Hiroshima
item.description: How a message of hope and peace is being spread by trees still growing 75 years later.

item.title: Tanzanite: Tanzanian miner earns millions after second rare find
item.description: Saniniu Laizer sells a Tanzanite stone for $2 million (£1.5m), months after a similar find.

item.title: Here are just some of the records Taylor Swift's Folklore has broken
item.description: The star's surprise eighth album sets a whole raft of new chart records in its first week on sale.

item.title: First SpaceX crewed mission lands safely
item.description: The moment the first crewed SpaceX mission splashes down safely in the Gulf of Mexico.

item.title: Coronavirus pandemic: Tracking the global outbreak
item.description: Key maps and charts explaining how the respiratory virus has spread around the world and how it is being dealt with.

item.title: Hiroshima and Nagasaki: Women survivors of the atomic bombs
item.description: August marks the 75th anniversary of the atomic bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki in 1945.

item.title: Americans in Africa: Why we left America to live in Africa
item.description: Three African Americans have been explaining why they left the US to find a better life in Africa.

item.title: TikTok: How would the US go about banning the Chinese app?
item.description: Several options exist, from preventing Google and Apple offering the app, to blocking its servers.

item.title: An underwater webcam in the port of Miami has become a lockdown sensation.
item.description: An underwater webcam in the port of Miami has become a lockdown sensation thanks to its tailless star 'Oval'.

item.title: Coronavirus: How pandemic pods and zutors are changing home-schooling
item.description: US parents are resorting to "pandemic pods" and garden classrooms - but will it deepen inequalities?

item.title: ‘I feel guilty for surviving’: The deadly hunt for jade in Myanmar
item.description: Nearly 200 people died last month in a jade mine landslide. Now the survivors are going back to work.

item.title: Iran women's podcast gives voice to victims of abuse
item.description: Women in Iran are often too scared to speak about domestic abuse - now a podcast gives them a voice.

item.title: Beyond TikTok: Who else might President Trump ban?
item.description: Other Chinese-owned software could face difficulties in the US, if TikTok ban goes ahead.

item.title: Belarus President Alexander Lukashenko under fire
item.description: President Alexander Lukashenko has kept Belarus in an iron grip, but protests have intensified.

item.title: Being a Chinese student in the US: ‘Neither the US nor China wants us’
item.description: Amid a global pandemic and diplomatic tensions, Chinese students in the US are feeling anxious.

item.title: Katie Mack: 'Knowing how the universe will end is freeing'
item.description: Astrophysicist Katie Mack has been researching The End of Everything.

item.title: Hume - the pivotal peacemaker in Northern Ireland
item.description: As SDLP leader, John Hume played a major role in bringing about Northern Ireland's peace process.

item.title: The boss who bounced her way to £3m from just £200
item.description: How Kimberlee Perry grew trampoline fitness company Bounce, which is aimed at women.

item.title: Nigerians' double blow: Currency woes and Covid-19
item.description: Three business owners explain how they are weathering the economic fallout.

item.title: Dortmund set 10 August deadline for Man Utd target Sancho deal
item.description: Borussia Dortmund set a 10 August deadline for any deal for Jadon Sancho - Manchester United's top transfer target - to be agreed.

item.title: Lakers secure top spot in Western Conference for first time since 2010
item.description: The Los Angeles Lakers secure the top spot in the NBA's Western Conference for the first time in 10 years after beating Utah Jazz.

item.title: Who were the post-lockdown winners and losers across Europe?
item.description: Who won the most games post-lockdown? Who scored the most goals? Did anyone fail to pick up even a single point? BBC Sport looks at the statistics from across Europe.

item.title: Gael Clichy: Ex-Man City defender on Man Utd, Pep Guardiola and Turkey
item.description: Ex-Arsenal and Manchester City defender Gael Clichy discusses Manchester United hopes, winning the title in Turkey and following in Pep Guardiola's footsteps.

item.title: Marc Marquez: MotoGP world champion has second arm surgery and will miss Czech GP
item.description: MotoGP world champion Marc Marquez will miss the Czech Grand Prix after a second operation on a broken arm.

item.title: Brentford and Fulham meet in 'the richest game in football'
item.description: Brentford and Fulham meet in the Championship play-off final at Wembley on Tuesday, a match often dubbed the richest in football.

item.title: Stokes boosts England by bowling in nets before first Test against Pakistan
item.description: England all-rounder Ben Stokes bowled at training on Monday as he strives for full fitness for the first Test against Pakistan which starts on Wednesday.

item.title: NBA: Black Lives Matter and basketball’s role in discussion on racism
item.description: Basketball is perhaps the sport best placed to challenge racial inequality. Is the NBA doing it right?
